# Intro

A short intro

```julia
using Bonsai

app = App()

function index(stream::HTTP.Stream)
    query = Bonsai.read( stream, Query(name=Union{String, Nothing}))
    name = isnothing(query.name) ? "John Doe" : query.name  
    Bonsai.write(stream, Body("Hi, $name"))
end

# register handler
app.get["/"] = index

start(app, port=9091)
```

This package provides abstraction so we can treat the `HTTP.Stream` like IO, reading and writing from it using types to specify what data we input and output.


Bonsai aims to be minimalistic and not impose a specific structure on the developer, for those familiar with python think Flask not Django.
